name: Alley Interactive
tag_list: media, news, mobile-web, wordpress, drupal, web-development, content-management-systems, cms
overview:
Alley Interactive is a web development and consulting firm that works primarily with large media and news operations to build and maintain content management systems and reader-facing sites with an eye towards high scalability, mobile readiness, and long-term maintainability of code and editorial processes.

Alley’s portfolio includes a variety of newspapers, magazines and web-based publications, such as the New York Observer, The New Republic, National Review Online, WBEZ/Chicago Public Media, Capital New York, and InterActiveCorp’s Writers Network.

In addition to the media industry, Alley has worked with several clients in the non-profit space (e.g. Tri-State Transportation Campaign, The College Board) and higher education (Rutgers University School of Law).

Alley is one of the initial members of Automattic Inc’s WordPress VIP Featured Partners program, and also has a long history with Drupal. Many of its projects have also involved collaborations with notable design firms, including Hard Candy Shell, Charming Robot, Catalyst Group, Hazan+Company, and Free Range.
